legal_basis: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act subsection 72(1)
risk_of_persecution: alleged persecution by a former committee member after exposing fund misappropriation
credibility_findings: doubts about credibility due to traveling through 12 countries without seeking asylum
decision_reasoning: fear was due to personal vengeance, not Convention grounds
conclusion_outcome: Federal Court upheld the Board's decision, finding no manifestly unreasonable error
result_of_case: Application for judicial review dismissed; family not recognized as refugees
